column4: If I get this message "W: GPG error: http://packages.medibuntu.org jaunty Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY 2EBC26B60C5A2783" when trying to do apt-get update, what am I supposed to do to make that repository also update?
Hm. When I add medibuntu repo and try to install skype under Jaunty amd64, it pulls me 32bit Skype when doing apt-get install skype. Why?
it uses binary compatibility with 32bit apps on 64bit installs.
is it harmless to install all those 32bit libraries and run 32bit programs under amd64?
thank you very much for answers.
also, you can use a skype-static version.
that has all the required libs built in so you don't need to pull many deps.
